sep.gaia.resources

Class DataResourceManager<R extends DataResource>

  • java.lang.Object
    • sep.gaia.resources.ResourceObservable<R>
      • sep.gaia.resources.DataResourceManager<R>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StateObserver
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MarkerResourceManager, POIManager, TileManager, WeatherManager, WikipediaManager

    public abstract class DataResourceManager<R extends DataResource>
extends ResourceObservable<R>
implements StateObserver
    This class is an abstract class for all object to be managed. It observes the actual state of the state objects and concrete implementations can load data by the means of the Loader. Object of the class can be observed in order to react on the availability of new data. The loading process of the data can be activated and deactivated, e.g. to prevent unnecessary loading of data. Furthermore an off-line flag can be set, e.g. to signal the concrete implementations not to transmit any further data over the network. So observers are informed about actualizations by data located in the random access memory.
    Author:
    Johannes Bauer (Spezifikation: Matthias Fisch)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataResourceManager(java.lang.String label)
      This method initializes an activated manager which is not off-line but has no loader for the moment.
      DataResourceManager(java.lang.String label, boolean enabled, boolean online)
      This method initializes an activated manager.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void disable()
      This method quits the manager, i.e. that the manager shall no longer inform about changes of state and holds no current used data.
      void enable()
      This method activates the manager, i.e. that the manager shall inform about changes of state.
      java.lang.String getLabel()
      Returns the label of this DataResourceManager in order to identify it.
      boolean isEnabled()
      This method tells if the manager is activated, i.e. if the manager shall inform about changes of state.
      boolean isOnline()
      This method tells if the manager is on-line, i.e. if the manager shall inform about changes of state but shall not load any data (if it is no online).
      void onExit()
      Called when the manager was last used at runtime.
      abstract void requestLoaderStop()
      This method sends a message to the loader to tell it to quit for the next possible moment.
      void setOnline(boolean online)
      This method sets the manager on-line if and only if online is true, i.e. the manager shall inform about changes of state but shall not load any data from tile api server.

      • Methods inherited from class sep.gaia.resources.ResourceObservable

        clearAll, notifyAll, register, unregister

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Methods inherited from interface sep.gaia.state.StateObserver

        onUpdate

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataResourceManager

        public DataResourceManager(java.lang.String label)
        This method initializes an activated manager which is not off-line but has no loader for the moment.
        Parameters:
        label - The name of the ResourceManager.

      • DataResourceManager

        public DataResourceManager(java.lang.String label,
                   boolean enabled,
                   boolean online)
        This method initializes an activated manager.
        Parameters:
        enabled - Flag to tell if the manager is activated at the beginning, i.e. if the manager shall inform about changes of state.
        offline - Flag to tell if the manager is off-line at the beginning, i.e. if the manager shall inform about changes of state but shall not load any data.

    • Method Detail

      • enable

        public void enable()
        This method activates the manager, i.e. that the manager shall inform about changes of state.

      • disable

        public void disable()
        This method quits the manager, i.e. that the manager shall no longer inform about changes of state and holds no current used data.

      • setOnline

        public void setOnline(boolean online)
        This method sets the manager on-line if and only if online is true, i.e. the manager shall inform about changes of state but shall not load any data from tile api server.
        Parameters:
        online - true to set the manager off-line.

      • requestLoaderStop

        public abstract void requestLoaderStop()
        This method sends a message to the loader to tell it to quit for the next possible moment.

      • onExit

        public void onExit()
        Called when the manager was last used at runtime. May be overridden by subclasses to do work, like writing data to disk. The default implementation doesn't do anything.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        This method tells if the manager is activated, i.e. if the manager shall inform about changes of state.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the manager is activated.

      • isOnline

        public boolean isOnline()
        This method tells if the manager is on-line, i.e. if the manager shall inform about changes of state but shall not load any data (if it is no online).
        Returns:
        true if and only if the manager is on-line.

      • getLabel

        public java.lang.String getLabel()
        Returns the label of this DataResourceManager in order to identify it.
        Returns:
